subject: Public Speaking
title: De Gaulle's Appeal of June 18
description: A fast breakdown of De Gaulle's Appeal of June 18 for builders.

hook.text: France had surrendered to Germany. From London, a little-known general broadcast a speech that saved French honor.

buildup.text: Charles de Gaulle told the French that the war was not over â€” that France had lost a battle, not the war.

discovery.text: Almost nobody heard the original broadcast. But the BBC replayed it, and the text spread through underground networks.

twist.text: The speech created the Free French movement from nothing. A single broadcast built a government in exile.

climax.text: De Gaulle proved that a leader doesn't need an army to start resistance. A voice and a microphone can suffice.

punchline.text: A country fell. A speech refused to accept it.

quiz.question: What did De Gaulle's June 18 speech accomplish?
options: It created the Free French resistance movement
